}} 'Lablab purpureus', commonly known as the 'hyacinth bean', 'Indian bean',
'calavance', 'seim' (Guyana and Trinidad and Tobago), 'Egyptian bean', 'njahi'
(in the Kikuyu language of Kenya), 'bulay' (Tagalog), 'bataw' (Bisaya), or 'Äáº­u
vÃ¡n' (Vietnamese), a species of bean in the family Fabaceae, is widespread as a
food crop throughout the tropics, especially in Africa, India, Bangladesh, and
Indonesia. A traditional food plant in Africa, this little-known vegetable in
the West has potential to improve nutrition, boost food security, foster rural
development and support sustainable landcare.
